cyclone.name: COLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 450 mi SW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast across the eastern Gulf, expected to cross Florida’s Big Bend Monday evening and then accelerate northeast just off the U.S. Southeast coast before racing into the open Atlantic

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Altamaha Sound GA to South Santee River SC under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Indian Pass FL to Englewood FL (Gulf side) and Altamaha Sound GA to Sebastian Inlet FL (Atlantic side) under Tropical Storm Warning
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf coast, Southeast Georgia, coastal South and North Carolina, then offshore into the western Atlantic
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible Wednesday as the storm passes well offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rainfall (generally 1–2 inches) possible Wednesday–early Thursday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along Delaware and New Jersey beaches
